reasoning: PCH type 3 is a rare autosomal recessive neurological disorder characterized by pons and cerebellar hypoplasia. Fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide in medical literature. Incidence estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on case reports and molecular studies of TSEN54 mutations.
source: Barth PG et al. (2007). Pontocerebellar hypoplasias: a diverse group of prenatal cerebellar developmental disorders. Semin Fetal Neonatal Med. 12(3):156-163
